page.title: 01Hill Farming Land.
page.content: This area near to the village of Crawford is mainly used for the farming of hill sheep.There are several farms in the area.The main farms being Whelphill,Stoneyburn and Midlock. Stoneyburn and Midlock straddle more than one block.We will therefore only being looking at Whelphill Farm. Most of the land is used for rough grazing. There are several small burns in the area which are tributaries of the Clyde.To the north east of this block is the Camps Reservoir which supplies water to the towns in the industrial belt of Lanarkshire.
